title: des_x
body: Des X is a man made demon from the Disgaea series (specifically, Disgaea 4). She is a more perfected version of Desco. Her most prominent traits include: a large tail, pinkish horns on her head, pale yellow and blackish purple colored patterns on her dress, 'Usatako' monster on her back, and her most recognizable trait, many dark green eyes on her body and dress. Like her sister Desco, Des X believes herself as a final boss, and is always looking for ways to improve her skills or prove them to others. Unlike her sister, Des X is more cruel and violent, [spoiler] as in truth, she was the one who mercilessly killed Fuka, Descos other (human) sister in order to have Fukas father, who is also Desco and Des X's creator, all to herself. [/spoiler] As she is a more perfected version of desco, Des X has all the same skills as Desco (minus her final one) and all the same evilities (abilities) as her (except her initial one). Des X is only playable though DLC in disgaea 4, and cannot be obtained any other way.

title: mahou_shoujo_pretty_sammy
body:
Two distinct series (3 issue OVA and 26 episodes sharing the same names) based on the premise of [[Masaki Sasami Jurai|Sasami]]'s voice actor and character design from [[Tenchi Muyou!]] being mutated into standard magical girl fodder. Most other Tenchi Muyou! characters appear in similarly altered form in the supporting cast, though most of them have (despite retaining their alien appearances) become ordinary humans.

h4. Related Characters

*  [[Amano Misao (Pretty Sammy)|Amano Misao]]/[[Pixy Misa]]

*  [[Ryou-Ouki]]

title: helicopter_cat
body:
Orvillecopter (aka helicopter cat, catcopter) "is a remote-controlled quadcopter resembling a flying cat created by Dutch artist Bart Jansen." [1]  According to Jansen, the quadcopter was created using the taxidermied skin of his dead pet Orville, who was named after Orville Wright. 

The original YouTube video [2], uploaded in March 2012, has garnered millions of hits. 



h4. Links

* [1] "Entry on Know Your Meme":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/orvillecopter-helicopter-cat
* [2] "Original YouTube video of Orvillecopter":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6c4nZJ4ryFE

title: lambretta
body: A brand of [[scooter|scooters]] produced by the Italian company Innocenti. The main competitor to Vespa. Innocenti sold the Lambretta brand, designs and manufacturing equipment to the Indian government in 1972, which produced Lambretta scooters for sale in India till the late 90s. A new line of Lambretta scooters debuted in 2011, with bodies based on the classic Lambretta design made in Italy, and SYM engines and CVT transmissions from Taiwan.

body:

title: miyamae_kanako
body:
The protagonist of [[Maria Holic]].

A tall, slender, well-endowed girl who, due to some form of allergy to men, had a traumatic incident with a boy at a young age. Now a lesbian, she transfers to a girls-only Catholic school in order to find her "fated one." However, she quickly learns that the girl she is most attracted to is actually a sadistic cross-dresser named [[Shidou Mariya]], who uses her lesbianism and his popularity to bend her to his will. 

She is somewhat perverted, frequently getting nosebleeds and excited by even a mere sight or suggestion of another girl's panties.

title: lml_star
body: The LML Star is either a 2 stroke or 4 stroke clone of the Vespa P Series, produced by Lohia Machinery Limited in India. LML produced scooters and parts under contract for Piaggio in the 80s and 90s, and after their contract ended, licensed versions sold under the LML brand. Imported in the US by Genuine Scooter Company and sold under the Stella name, stella being Italian for star.

title: clarice_di_lanza
body:
A playable character from the [[Arcana Heart]] series, introduced in [[Arcana Heart 2]] and reappearing in [[Arcana Heart 3]].

Clarice always has a composed personality and a smile on her face. She never fusses over trivial matters; she just enjoys the life she has. She used to be a noble from the Demon Realm. But she abandoned such a lavish life style and decided to live in the human world due to the influence of [[lilica felchenerow|Lilica]]'s father, Felchenerow. This still would not change the fact that she's a demon of pure blood. After learning of her existence, the Western European Spirit Sector sent [[Elsa la Conti|Elsa]] to fight her to the death. In order to save Elsa's life, Clarice imbued the power of the Arcana "Punishment" into her and took the power of the Arcana "Sin."
other_names: クラリーチェ・ディ・ランツァ

title: elsa_la_conti
body:
A playable character from the [[Arcana Heart]] series, introduced in [[Arcana Heart 2]] and reappearing in [[Arcana Heart 3]].

After losing her entire family in the hands of demons, Elsa enlisted in the Western Europe Spirit Sector. Elsa is usually mild-mannered, but she's also single-minded and airheaded at times. She is very straight forward and sometimes too strict on herself. She was once pitted in a fight to the death with [[Clarice di Lanza|Clarice]]. In the end, she and Clarice had their lives saved by the Arcanas Sin and Punishment, respectively, and are now close friends travelling the world as immortals.
other_names: エルザ・ラ・コンティ

title: electrolarynx
body:
An electrolarynx, sometimes referred to as a "throat back", is a medical device about the size of a small electric razor used to produce clearer speech by those who have lost their voicebox, usually due to cancer of the larynx. The most common device is a handheld, battery-operated device placed under the mandible which produces vibrations and allow speech.
Source: "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mechanical_larynx

title: vespa_p-series
body: The Vespa P Series of [[scooter|scooters]] was introduced in 1977 and production continues to today. The P Series is one of the most widely produced motor vehicles in history, manufactured not only by Piaggio in Italy, but also under license and contract by various manufacturers around the world, including India and Indonesia. Specific models include the P125X, P150X, P200E, PX125, PX150, PX200, and some clones or models based off of the P Series include the Bajaj Chetek and Legend, and the LML Star/Belladonna/Genuine Stella 2T and 4T. The P Series was the "Largeframe" models and its "Smallframe" counterpart is the Vespa PK. The P Series is the last all metal bodied, manual transmission "vintage" scooter produced by Vespa.

title: hatsuse_izuna
body:
初瀬いづな（はつせいづな、[i]Hatsuse Izuna[/i]）

A character in [[No Game No Life]].

A [i]Warbeast[/i] girl and the ambassador of the Warbeast race to Elchea.

Outwardly, she is an 8 years old girl who enjoys being petted, speaks using a lot of foul words without even realizing it, and ends every sentence with "desu" (translated as "please"). Inwardly, she possesses enormous physical abilities and has heightened senses of magic and psychological perception.

Izuna, like everyone else of her kind, has [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]]. She has [[slit_pupils|slit-pupiled]] [[purple eyes]] and [[short_hair|short]] [[purple hair]] that is decorated with a [[hairband]]. The clothes she is wearing is that of [[japanese_clothes|Japanese clothes]]; [[wide_sleeves|wide-sleeved]] [[short kimono]], [[large bow]] over the obi, [[tabi]], and a pair of [[geta]].

h4.See also:
* Wikia (EN): http://no-game-no-life.wikia.com/wiki/Hatsuse_Izuna
* MyAnimeList (EN): http://myanimelist.net/character/97767/Izuna_Hatsuse

title: stephanie_dora
body:
ステファニー・ドーラ（[i]Stephanie Dora[/i]）

A character in [[No Game No Life]].

The granddaughter of the former king of [i]Imanity[/i]. After the king's death, she aims to become the next queen of the country, only to then lose miserably to one [[Clammy Zell]].

While remarked as politically, academically, and socially adept, her naivety and incompetence at gaming in general has sometimes, if not always, put her in bad situations. And because of this, she becomes the series' butt monkey in no time at all.

Stephanie, who is occasionally also referred to as Steph, has [[blue eyes]], [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] that is decorated with a large [[hair_ornament|blue]] [[hair_flower|flower]]. Her clothes consist of [[dress]] that emphasizes her [[cleavage]], [[detached collar]] with [[bowtie]], and a pair of [[boots]].

h4.See also:
* Wikia (EN): http://no-game-no-life.wikia.com/wiki/Stephanie_Dola
* MyAnimeList (EN): http://myanimelist.net/character/82527/Stephanie_Dora

title: sora_(no_game_no_life)
body:
空（そら、[i]Sora[/i]）

One of the main characters in [[No Game No Life]].

An 18 years old [[neet]], [[hikikomori|shut-in]] gamer along with his step-sister, [[shiro_(no_game_no_life)|Shiro]]. Despite being a shut-in, however, he has an extremely outgoing and confident personality. Together, they form『　　』（空白、くうはく、[i]kuuhaku[/i]; lit. blank space）

Sora is a [[skinny|tall and thin]] person, with [[spiked_hair|spiky]] [[black hair]] in the light novel and [[red_hair|maroon]] in the anime, also donning [[red_eyes|red]] [[tsurime|eyes]] with [[bags_under_eyes|dark bags]] under them. He also typically wears yellow [[t-shirt]] with [[clothes_writing|the text]] "I ♥ Humanity" written in Japanese on it.

h4.See also:

title: kobayashi_mikoto
body:
A character in [[Reidol]].
She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]].


h4. Profile 
From http://www.cyc-soft.com/cyclet_pro/idol/character.html
[quote]五反田の秘書。

かつては村上とユニットを組んで歌手としてデビューしていた。
一時は恋仲になっていたが、
引退と同時に分かれている。

引退しようとしていた村上を
マネージャーとして事務所に
置いておくように社長に提言したのは彼女だが、かつての恋人のよしみなのかは不明。

まだ気があるようなふりをしながら性的な誘惑を何度も仕掛けてからかってくる。

五反田の意思を伝えるために
メッセンジャー的な役割も担っている。[/quote]

title: sakurai_yui
body:
A character in [[Reidol]].
She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]].


h4. Profile 
From http://www.cyc-soft.com/cyclet_pro/idol/character.html
[quote]清楚系アイドルとして
現在売出し中のアイドル。

だが、清楚な姿は仕事用で
実際は高飛車なところがあり、
下に見た人間に対しては
高圧的に接し、とことん蔑む。

もとは歌手を希望していたのだが、アイドルとして売り出されてしまった事に不満を持っている。

溜まっていた不満を爆発させ、
マネージャーである村上のミュージシャン時代をバカにする発言をしてしまい、激昂した村上にレイプされる結果を招いてしまう。

犯されたことにショックを受けて
いたが事務所はそんな彼女を
コネクション強化のための道具
にする事を決めてしまう。[/quote]

title: tsuki_tsuki!
body:
Tsuki Tsuki! (つきツキ！) is a light novel series written by Yujin Goto and illustrated by [[Korie Riko]], published in MF Bunko J. 

Synopsis : 

One day Shinobu wakes up just to find a naked blonde girl sleeping besides him. He has no memory whatsoever of her. Who is she? Why is she in his bed? Why is she naked? To make matters worse, his sister comes in and sees them. What will happen now?

title: moppy_(infinite_stratos)
body:
Moppy is a parody character of [[Shinonono Houki]] from [i][[Infinite Stratos]][/i]. She is a [[Chibi]] character, naked at all times, who always makes sarcastic comments.

The following is a quotation from "EvaGeeks.org Forum":http://forum.evageeks.org/post/505786/Puella-Magi-Madoka-Magika/#505722.

[i]10. モッピー　Moppy　
An omnipresent little character who is a clear parody of Houki Shinonono 篠ノ之 箒 from Infinite Stratos. Moppy originated in 2ch sales thread, and was based on the character Houki Shinonono. Without any base in the anime, this Houki parody came out to mock and laugh at other anime for selling poorer than I.S. (or as likely, going to sell poorer than I.S.) or just laugh at this and that (like sales trend or related manga/novel sales), but when she was proven wrong, then she would smilingly declared that she knew all along the other anime will do well or that she is in fact a fan all along. Now its use is so ubiquitous that you see her in book stores, game centers, video rental stores etc to make sales speech over this or that. She likes to use the words "Moppy always know..." モッピー知ってるよ The name Moppy came from the name Houki because in Japanese Houki means Broom, which will be Mop in its modern incarnation.[/i]

h4.See also

* Nicopedia article (JPN): http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/モッピー
* "Google Image Search":https://www.google.com/images?hl=en&source=hp&q="インフィニット・ストラトス"|"IS"+モッピー&gbv=2&aq=f&oq=&aqi=&biw=1920&bih=916&sei=FeCoUJPmA-mBiQe2wIGgDA

title: aquarion_evol
body:
アクエリオンEVOL 

A winter 2012 anime produced by Satelight and [[Kawamori Shouji]] and sequel to [i][[Sousei no Aquarion]][/i], set 12,000 years after the end of the first series. 

The show details humanity's new struggle against the Abductors from a mysterious realm using the Aquarion, a mecha formed from three vehicles operated by members of Neo DEAVA, a training institution for psychically-endowed teens. Among its newest members are [[Amata Sora]], a boy with a mysterious power of levitation, and [[Mikono Suzushiro]], a girl he saves from an Abductor attack.

title: abarakasen
body:
A severely emaciated version of [[Ibaraki Kasen]], skinny to the point of her ribs being visible under her skin. 

Its origin lies in the entry from [i]Perfect Memento in Strict Sense[/i] about hermits, which describes them as usually eating only a few fruits and nuts, and being capable of not eating at all once they turn 500 years old. The name [i]Abarakasen[/i] (肋華仙) is itself a pun between Kasen's nickname [i]Ibarakasen[/i] (茨華仙) and [i]abara[/i], the Japanese word for "rib"; in English it would be something like "Ribarakasen". 

h4.See also 

* http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kasen_Ibaraki#Fanon
* http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Perfect_Memento_in_Strict_Sense/Hermits

title: gateball
body:
"Gateball is a mallet team sport similar to croquet. It is a fast-paced, non-contact, highly-strategic team game, which can be played by anyone regardless of age or gender. 

"Gateball is played on a rectangular court 20–25 metres long and 15–20 metres wide. Each court has three gates and a goal pole. The game is played by two teams (red and white) of up to five players. Each player has a numbered ball corresponding to their playing order. The odd-numbered balls are red and the even-numbered balls are white. Teams score one point for each ball hit through a gate and two points for hitting the goal pole, in accordance with the rules. A game of gateball lasts for thirty minutes and the winner is the team with the most points at the end of the game." [1] 

h4. See also 

* [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gateball

title: jamadhar
body:
Jamadhar is a weapon of Indian origin, looking somewhat like a mixture of brass knuckles and a dagger.

Also known as katar or katara. "Japanese Wikipedia article on jamadhar":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ジャマダハル states that "the western naming convention of Indian "push daggers":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Push_dagger as katar, kutar or katara is actually a misapplication of the word, as katar properly refered to a type of double-edged short sword. This misinterpretation arose from the illustrations of the katar and jamadhar being reversed in "'Ain-i-Akbari'":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ain-i-Akbari a 16th century historical account authored by "Abu'l-Fazl,":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abu%27l-Fazl_ibn_Mubarak who served Emperor Akbar of the Mughal Empire." 

Famously worn by the Assassin class in [[Ragnarok Online]] and [[Diablo 2]], and by [[Voldo]] in the [[Soulcalibur]] series (who [[dual wielding|dual wields]] a triple-bladed variant).

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* "Wikipedia on katar":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katara_%28dagger%29

title: locadol_promotion
body:
The [i]2.5 Dimension TV: Locadol Promotion Illustration Contest[/i] was run on Pixiv in 2013 from June 13 to July 31.

h4. Contest details

Participants were to create "an original 'local idol' character with a reference to a local area, such as clothing, accessories, songs, and dances." [1] Participants were then to tag their post with their prefecture or, for locations outside of Japan, their country (ex. USA). 


h4. Contest results

The contest results were announced "here":http://www.pixiv.net/contest/locadolpromotion_announce/.

* Six First-place winners won 50,000 yen
** West
*** [[Okinawa]] || [[amksr417]] || post #1640385
*** Nara || [[teru (grafroller)]] || post #1640387
*** [[Hiroshima]] || [[kurubu]] || post #1640389
** East
*** [[Hokkaido]] || [[shirotsuna]] || post #1640391
*** [[Kanagawa]] || [[yurikuta tsukumi]] || post #1640398
*** Saitama || [[naako0023]] || post #1640403

* Up to 47 second-place winners won 25,000 yen  (following list is not comprehensive)
** Touhoku
*** [[aomori_prefecture|Aomori]] || [[yokiri]] || post #1530875
** Kantou
*** Tokyo || [[ochau]] || post #1475806
** Chuubu
*** Niigata || [[yokiri]] || post #1530874


h4. See Also

* http://www.pixiv.net/contest/locadolpromotion.php
* [1] "Contest terms and conditions":http://www.pixiv.net/contest/locadolpromotion_terms.php
* "Post describing contest":http://www.pixiv.net/member_illust.php?mode=medium&illust_id=36352511

ぴくカゲ pikukage

Pixiv Shadow has had a few different runs, similar to [[Pixiv Fantasia]].

h4. Pixiv Shadow 1

The first Pixiv Shadow ran from 2008/7/30 to 2008/8/10. 

h4. [[Pixiv Shadow 2]]
Aka "Kage Piku Ⅱ" or Pikukagetsu. Tags are attached to the work of Kage Piku Ⅱ. Also known as "pixiv shadow" and "pixkage (Pikkage)". 

"Ⅱ Piku Kage" on Pixiv is one of the users in the planning, and modern characters, "Kage," The Guardian drawing called "Kage Piku" second edition. 
Dates are June 9 - July 19, 2009. The main railroad project. 


h4. [[Pixiv Shadow 3]]

The third Pixiv Shadow ran from 2011/7/3 to 2011/8/6.

title: odin_(seikai_seifuku)
body:
Alter ego of [[morozumi_yasube|Yasube Morozumi]]. Even though he is the member of the inner circle, his "duty" there is to be the butt monkey and also all kinds of minor housework in the HQ.

[spoiler]He later defects to the governor of Tokyo, but is accepted back (after some time not getting dinner as a penance) after the governor is defeated by Zvezda.[/spoiler]

Etymology: Odin/Один is Russian for "one".

title: professor_um
body:
Alter ego of [[natasha_(sekai_seifuku)|Natasha resp. Natalia Vasylchenko]], the member of the inner circle of Zvezda. She is the main technology expert of Zvezda and also responsible for the maintenance of their superweapons and the HQ.

[spoiler]She was separated from her parents by unknown beings she called "fairies" and rescued by Kate. Her parents seem to have a connection to whatever force stood behind the governor of Tokyo, Kyoushirou Jimon.[/spoiler]

Etymology: Um/Ум is Russian for "mind".

title: sayakaba
body:
[[Animalization]] of [[Miki Sayaka]] as a hippopotamus.

This is derived from a pun. One of Sayaka's famous lines from [i][[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]][/i] is:

* あたしって、ほんと[b]バカ[/b] ([[I'm such a fool]])

If you flip the characters in バカ (baka, meaning idiot/fool), you get:

* あたしって、ほんと[b]カバ[/b] (I really am a hippo)


h4. See also

* [[Gomadoka]], an animalization of [[Kaname Madoka]] as a seal.
* [[Homurakko]], an animalization of [[Akemi Homura]] as a sea otter.
* [[Mamikurage]], an animalization of [[Tomoe Mami]] as a jellyfish.

title: taihou_to_stamp
body:
大砲とスタンプ (Taihou to Stamp, lit. Guns and Stamps)

Manga series by [[Hayami Rasenjin]], serialized in Koudansha's "Gekkan Morning Two.":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9C%88%E5%88%8A%E3%83%A2%E3%83%BC%E3%83%8B%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B0two 

The story is set in an alternate world with 20th century-like technology, during a great war between the alliance of the Grand Duchy (Russia that never formed) and the Empire (Poland-Lithuania that never fell into ruin) on one side, and the Republic (the Ottoman Empire that never fell apart) on the other.

Lieutenant Martina M. Mayakovskaya is a new officer in the Grand Duchy Logistics Corps. It's a branch of the armed forces responsible for transportation and supply that is looked down upon by the rest of the military as "paper soldiers". Martina's assignment is supposed to be a comfortable desk job dealing with stamping paperwork, but for some reason wherever she goes, she ends up in the middle of combat. Also, what's that [[stamp_(taihou_to_stamp)|eight-legged pseudoweasel]] that she adopted as a pet (or it adopted her?), and is it just a coincidence that it seems to be saving her from harm every time?

h4.Characters

* [[Martina M Mayakovskaya]]

title: too_many_frills
body:
Known as Frill Jigoku (フリル地獄, literally, "Frill Hell") on Pixiv. This tag is for images with unholy emphasis on frills.

Here's some good qualifications for entry:

* Ungodly amounts of frills.
* Multiple layers of frills in the same general area, especially on large skirts.
* Frills over multiple portions of an outfit. Frilled skirts are common and almost required, so having frills on gloves, thighhighs, hats, sleeves, shoes, pacemakers, etc. helps.
* Inventive or uncommon use of frills.
* Frills take up a noticable chunk of an image. It's hard to place a number on this one, but if frills take up half the image then that post is almost assuredly qualified. A more realistic expectation would be somewhere along 15%.

For characters that usually wear a lot of frills, the bar should be a little bit higher than normal.

In short, there are just too many frills.

h4. See Also

* [[too many]]

title: uriko-hime_to_amanojaku
body:
瓜子姫 (うりこひめ / [i][[Uriko-hime]][/i], literally, "melon princess"), or alternatively, うりこひめとあまのじゃく (Uriko-hime and an Amanojaku) is a Japanese fairy tale. Among the folktales in which the short, demon-like humanoid called [[amanojaku_(creature)|Amanojaku]] appears, this story is the only type which is widely recounted throughout Japan.

In a basic summary of the story, a baby born from a melon is carefully raised by an old couple, and she grows up to be a beautiful young woman skilled at weaving. While her adoptive parents are away from their home, Amanojaku tricks and kidnaps her. The demon impersonates Uriko-hime, but while the impostor is going to a wealthy man's home to marry him, the fake Uriko-hime is accused by the cawing of a crow, and reveals her true identity, whereupon his true form is revealed, and the old couple and accompanying villagers beat him to death (or alternatively, he runs away).

This folktale is known for the countless variations on the story depending on the region. In southwestern Japan, her clothes are stolen and she is tied up to a tree, but in many cases she escapes unharmed and lives happily in the end. In northwestern Japan, in many versions the poor young woman is tricked to climb a persimmon tree from which she falls to her death. Amanojaku flays her skin and impersonates her by wearing it.

At the end of the tale, it is often accompanied by an explanation that the place where Amanojaku was killed was a field of buckwheat, and that is why buckwheat stalks are red.

title: asame_shinbun
body:
朝目新聞([i]Asame Shinbun[/i], Asame News) is a famous Japanese website centered around picture [[parody|parodies]] of manga and game characters. The website's name is a parody of "Asahi Shinbun":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asahi_Shimbun , and the webmaster is "机器猫 (Ji qi mao)." (His name is based on [[doraemon_(character)|Doraemon]]'s name in Chinese, but he is Japanese.)

The many images posted on the website's six [[oekaki]]/image boards are archived by genre on the place called "Asame Graph." Also, other interesting links and related articles are listed across the top page of the website.

The website has a long history, and among the posters on the imageboards, there are people who became professional artists. 

h4.See Also

* Asame Shinbun: http://www.ne.jp/asahi/asame/shinbun/
* Asame Graph: http://asame.sakura.ne.jp/graph/bbsgal.html
* 机器猫's Twitter account: http://twitter.com/asamenews

title: ginoza_nobuchika
body:
[b]宜野座 伸元 (ぎのざ のぶちか)[/b]

A character from [[Psycho-Pass]],the lead Inspector of Unit One of the Public Safety Bureau's Criminal Investigation Division. Ginoza holds an extreme distrust of Latent Criminals and is a serious man who appears to have based most of his life on his job as an Inspector. Despite his disposition he is actually on relatively good terms with his Enforcers. He shows concern for his subordinate [[Tsunemori Akane]] and warns her about the possibility of an Inspector becoming a latent criminal using [[Kougami Shin'ya]] as an example. Frequently called "Gino" by Kougami. It is revealed that [spoiler][[Tomomi Masaoka]] is his father, and he harbors resentment towards him for having become a criminal and leaving him and his mother in a difficult situation. He slightly reconciles with him afterwards. In episode 21, Nobuchika's left arm is crushed by a trap set by [[Makishima Shougo]].[/spoiler]

Its English version has a bit different story from the Japanese version of it. The original story takes place in 2015 and the player is a HIGH-MACS pilot of the APC (Asian Pacific Community)'s Foreign Legion. In the English version, the player is a member of the UAC (United America Countries) in 2074.

title: hamburger_steak
body:
A [i]Hamburger Steak[/i] is a dish which consists of ground meat clumped together in a round shape and cooked. Unlike a meatloaf, neither a mold nor oven are used, and it is mainly cooked on a frying pan.
Although it is known by several names, such as “hamburger patty” or “salisbury steak”, in Japan it is called either “ハンバーグ (hamburg)” or “ハンバーグステーキ (hamburg steak).” Moreover, just like its name, this dish's ingredients and seasonings all vary slightly.
In Japan, it is extremely popular among children, and is a standard part of the menu in school lunches and family restaurants. 

h4.See also

title: harken_browning
body:
The protagonist of [[super_robot_wars_og_saga_mugen_no_frontier|Super Robot Taisen - OG Saga: Endless Frontier]]. He is voiced by [[Hiyama Nobuyuki]]. Wields a [[bayonet]]-equipped [[assault rifle]] with an underslung [[pile bunker]] called the "Night Fowl" and a long-barreled [[revolver]] called the "Longtomb Special".

A bounty hunter who, along with his bodyguard / assistant / foil [[Aschen Brodel]] journey the Endless Frontier in search of adventure.

[spoiler]Is actually W-00, the first prototype of the W-Series which spawned both Aschen (W-07) and her younger "sister" [[Lamia Loveless]] (W-17); a genetically synthesized human created by, and based on the DNA of, [[Lemon Browning]].[/spoiler]

Finding this out doesn't actually cause him to angst about it too much, though; he even turns it into a boob joke referencing [[Nanbu_Kaguya|Kaguya]]'s [[large breasts]] ("It's not like that lovely bunch of coconuts is just gonna disappear some day.").

title: masaoka_tomomi
body:
[b]征陸 智己 (まさおか ともみ)[/b] 

A character from [[Psycho-Pass]], an Enforcer for Unit One. A laid back and friendly person, Masaoka is the oldest member of the group, and serves as a mentor for [[Tsunemori Akane]]. He has a cybernetic arm and a scar on his face. He was shown painting in his spare time. Due to his age and his previous status as an Inspector back in the first days of the Sibyl System, Masaoka has a vast amount of knowledge in the field of criminality, even being able to identify a firearm, which have virtually disappeared from the eyes of society since decades. He works well with [[Kougami Shinya]] and often accompanies him and [[Tsunemori Akane]] during investigations. It is revealed that [spoiler]he is Ginoza's father. He became increasingly angry about the Sybil System and the accumulation of his doubts about the system led him to being labeled a Latent Criminal and demoted into Enforcer status. Although Ginoza is cold with him, Masaoka is shown to deeply care for his son, and they start to grow closer after a while. Masaoka dies in episode 21, saving Ginoza from a dynamite thrown by [[Makishima Shougo]].[/spoiler]

title: sen'yuu.
body:
戦勇。 is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Haruhara Robinson]]. It was first published as web manga in Niconico Seiga in August 2010 and because of it's popularity, it was serialized in Jump Square since June 2012. It was also adapted into an anime television series in 2013. 

Long ago, there lived an evil being who reigned over the world through fear, called Satan Rchimedes. He invaded the human world with his many demon underlings, spreading madness and chaos everywhere. One thousand years ago, this menace was sealed by the hero Creation, and peace returned to the world. However, a gigantic hole suddenly opened up in the world one day, and demons appeared. The king thinks that this portends the return of the demon king Rchimedes and The king decreed that the descendants of the hero must take on the threat, and 75 people showed up. Hero No. 45 (Alba) and a sadistic palace warrior (Ros) team up, and their adventure begins. 

h4. See Also 

* "Original Web Manga Page":http://seiga.nicovideo.jp/comic/29?track=list

title: another_world
body:
[b]Another World[/b], also known as [b]Out of This World[/b] in North America and [b]Outer World[/b] (アウターワールド [i]Autā Wārudo[/i]) in Japan, is a legendary 1991 [[Science Fiction]] cinematic platformer action-adventure [[video game]] designed and created by the French programmer and computer graphical artist [[Eric Chahi]] for Delphine Software.

The game tells the story of [[Lester Knight Chaykin]], a young scientist who, as a result of an experiment gone wrong, finds himself in a dangerous [[alien]] world where he is forced to fight for his survival.

Originally developed for the Amiga and Atari ST and later released for the Apple IIGS and DOS platforms, the game was widely ported to many other contemporary systems. 

Later efforts resulted in several game engine recreations for the game that permitted it to run on modern computers, consoles and mobile phones. 

In 2006, Chahi independently released a 15th Anniversary Edition for modern computers, and a subsequent 20th Anniversary Edition in 2011 that adapted the game for numerous modern consoles and mobile computing platforms. An HD port for the PS3, PS4, XBox 360 and XBox One console was released in 2014.

Another World was highly innovative in its use of cinematic effects in both real-time and cutscenes, which granted the game praise amongst critics and commercial success. 

It also influenced many other video game designers: Ueda Fumito cited it as an inspiration for his creation of [[Ico]] and [[Shadow of the Colossus]]. [[Hideo Kojima]], creator of [[Metal Gear (series)]], said that it was one of the five games that influenced him the most. Video game designer Suda Goichi called it his favourite game of all time.

h4. See also

* [[Buddy (Another World)]]

title: intestines
body:
The intestines, or bowels, are the segment of the alimentary canal extending from the stomach to the anus and, in humans and other mammals, they consist of two segments, the small intestine and the large intestine. In humans, the small intestine is further subdivided into the duodenum, jejunum and ileum while the large intestine is subdivided into the cecum and colon.

Use this tag on images where intestines, whether large or small, are visible.

title: battle_hopper
body: A living motorcycle used by [[Kamen Rider BLACK]] ([[Minami Koutarou]]). It was created by Gorgom, made specifically for the upcoming Creation Kings Black Sun and [[Shadow Moon]]. The Battle Hopper has the ability to heal its own wounds if damaged, and can stand on its own if knocked over. His special move is the Dynamic Smash, a body slam attack that is executed at full speed. Before the finale, Battle Hopper was later stolen by Shadow Moon and dies in the final episode, but would later resurrect as '''Acrobatter''' in response to BLACK's evolution as [[Kamen Rider BLACK RX|RX]].

title: putotyra_(ooo_combo)
body:
One of [[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s final combos, accessed via the Ptera, Tricera, and Tyranno Core Medals.

It is easily one of the most powerful Combos in OOO's arsenal, but it will slowly turn him into a mindless beast if he stays in the Combo for too long until recently when Kamen Rider OOO managed to gain control of the Purple Cores (if barely), but he still suffers from the physical strain resulting from Combo use, and is still at risk of "letting himself go" if he does not consciously keep control.

As a result of the purple Medals residing in his body, [[Hino Eiji|Eiji]] is undergoing a process known as "Greeedification", gradually turning him into a Greeed the longer the Medals are inside him. PuToTyra has a power that is capable of destroying or damaging Core Medals. After Eiji gains two more Purple Medals, he can access this form in the usual way or can transform straight into Putotyra while in Greeed form.

Unlike the other combos, Putotyra causes most of the OOO armor to become white and cannot form a Random Combo with the other Core Medals, as the purple Medals are made in nature as the antithesis of desire, negating the power of the other Core Medals. The O Scanner announces this Combo by the call "PuToTyrannosaurus" instead of "PuToTyra".

Putotyra's flight speed is faster than [[TaJaDor (OOO Combo)|TaJaDor]], has greater jumping height, and its punching and kicking powers are stronger than the other Combos, making the "Invincible Combo" nickname a well-deserved one.

OOO can now use the wings on the Ptera Head, called External Fins, to fly, as well as to freeze the opponent with a blast of [[ice|icy]] air; the horns on the Tricera Shoulders, called the Wind Stinger, which can stretch into various lengths according to Eiji's command; and the Tyranno Legs' thigh armor can combine to form a tail, called the Tail Divider, that can give off a devastating blow.

Also, like Tajador, this Combo has its own [[weapon]], an [[axe]] called the Medagabryu that also doubles as a [[bazooka]], enabling OOO to unleash the full potential of the Purple Core Medals. The Medagabryu can draw out the full potential of the Cell Medals, by inserting a number of Cell Medals into the "mouth". Doing so in any Combo other than Putotyra will make it announce a Combo and a jingle remix, except for the TaJaDor Combo. When Cell Medals are inserted in the Medagabryu when in the Putotyra Combo, OOO can perform a Putotyranno Hissatsu depending on the weapon's mode. When in Axe Mode, OOO can perform the Ground of Rage or the Strain Doom when in Bazooka Mode.

His Scanning Charge is the Blasting Freezer, where OOO uses his Tricera Shoulders' Wind Stingers to stab his opponents in the shoulders to hold them in place, while he uses his Ptera Head's External Fins to freeze them immediately after, and the Tyranno Leg's Tail Divider to finish them off by smashing them into frozen shards.

title: tendou_souji
body:
天道 総司

The lead character of [[Kamen Rider Kabuto (series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]].

He is a calm man who "walks the path of heaven, to rule over all", hence his name. The meaning of this name is inherited from his grandmother, and Tendou would later be chosen by ZECT to be the holder of the Kabuto Zecter, allowing him to become [[Kamen Rider Kabuto]].

title: tourmaline
body:
A crystal boron silicate mineral compounded with elements such as aluminium, iron, magnesium, sodium, lithium, or potassium. Tourmaline is classified as a semi-precious stone and the gemstone comes in a wide variety of colors.

It is well known for emitting invisible infrared rays that help heal a person's body from the inside.

body: A major protagonist in [[Slayers]] who accompanies [[Lina Inverse]]'s party for the sake of justice. She knows white magic and Shamanistic magic, and often attacks in tandem with [[Zelgadiss Graywords]]. [spoiler][[Naga the serpent]] is her long lost sister, which may explain how she's particularly developed for her age[/spoiler]

title: dragonninja
body:
[b]DragonNinja[/b] (ドラゴンニンジャ), known outside of Japan as [b]Bad Dudes Vs. DragonNinja[/b] and often referred to simply as [b]Bad Dudes[/b], is a 1988 beat 'em up arcade [[video game]] developed and published by [[Data East]]. The game is notable because it deals with 2 lone street fighters facing hordes of powerful ninja and also has a memorable epic soundtrack composed by the late "Azusa Hara":http://www.vgmpf.com/Wiki/index.php?title=Azusa_Hara, a female video game composer who did the music for several other famous Data East games. 

During the game player one controls the character named "Blade" in white pants and player two controls the character named "Striker" in green pants, who have the ability to do punches, kicks and jumps. Some moves are special like spinning kicks and the ability to charge themselves up with "inner energy" by holding the punch button to throw a powerful long-range attack that hits all opponents in front of the player. Most enemies can be beaten with only a single hit of any kind. Players will also come across several power-ups: some are weapons like [[sai_(weapon)|sai]] knives and [[nunchaku]]s, and some are energy drinks that recharge the player's health, or clocks that add more seconds to the remaining time.

The various types of [[ninja]] enemies encountered in the game have their own means of attack. The basic blue-colored ninja directly charge the player, while some leap with their [[katana]] swords or throw [[shuriken]]s and [[makibishi]]; there are also acrobatic kunoichi female ninja, attack dogs and even ninja who are on fire. At the end of each level, one of the "super ninja" bosses also appear, until the last level where they all face the players again before the final boss, the titular Dragonninja. 

Dragonninja was followed by a 1991 spiritual successor called [b]Crude Buster[/b] (known outside of Japan as [b]Two Crude Dudes[/b]). 

After Data East became defunct due to their bankruptcy in 2003, G-Mode bought the intellectual rights to the arcade game as well as most other Data East games and licensed them globally. The arcade version is also featured, along with several other Data East arcade games, on the [[Wii]] title [i]Data East Arcade Classics[/i], produced by Majesco Entertainment with permission from G-Mode and released on February 19, 2010. 

h4. See also

* [[Blade (Dragonninja)]]
* [[Striker (Dragonninja)]]
* [[Zako ninja]]
* [[Nage ninja]]
* [[Buki ninja]]
* [[Kabuto (Dragonninja)]]
* [[Karnov]]

title: condensed_milk
body:
Milk which has had its water removed until it develops a syrup-like viscosity.  The general term "condensed milk" is usually considered synonymous in both America and Japan with "sweet condensed milk," which has significant amounts of sugar added to it.

In Japan, as in many parts of the world, sweet condensed milk is sold in squeeze bottles as a dessert topping.  It's even a semi-popular topping for [[shaved ice]].

h4. See also

body: Feet together, legs together, perfectly straight, arms folded, pelvis out and forward. title: tic-tac-toe
body:

title: flying_polyp
body:
A [b]Flying Polyp[/b] is a member of a fictional [[alien]] race in the [[Cthulhu Mythos]]. 

The creatures first appeared in [[h_p_lovecraft|H. P. Lovecraft's]] short story "The Shadow out of Time" (1936).
He never gave an official name for the [[monster]], though, they're often called [i]Elder Beings[/i] or [i]Polypous Race[/i] in English and 盲目のもの ([i]Moumoku no Mono[/i], lit. [i]Blind Ones[/i]) in Japanese.

The [[Great Race of Yith]] gained a temporary victory over them using [[yithian_energy_weapon|their energy weapons]]. Yithians drove them underground and sealed the tunnels to the surface. Eventually, the Polyps rose up and got their revenge on the Great Race.

They're sometimes depicted as [[floating]] amorphic monstruosities with [[tentacles]]. 

h4.See also

* Wikipedia article: "Flying polyp":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flying_polyp 
* [[Great Race of Yith]]

title: hoshino_yumemi
body:
Main character from the visual novel [[Planetarian]] - The Reverie Of A Little Planet.
She goes by the name Reverie Planetarian in the unofficial translation, a name adopted by most fans, which actually refers to the subtitle of the game, rather than the character herself.

She was originally known as Hoshino Yumemi, literally "dreamer  who sees the stars", and was designed by [[Komatsu Eiji]]. Her voice, in CD and PS2 versions, is [[Suzuki Keiko]].

h4. Fanbase

A lot of people have fallen in love with Reverie, helped by her, for this time, cheerful and welcoming disposition, as well as a optimistic attitude to everything, which, in a normal situation would be highly welcomed, but, in Planetarian, is actually loathed, since the main character finds her impossible to deal with.

h4. Character

In Planetarian, she is the only form of life encountered, beyond the player's character and automated war machines in the entire game, and is hated, early on, for being so oblivious to her lone state.
She also is subject to one of the most tragic fates in the visual novel genre, since, due to the linear nature of Planetarian, which is more like a e-book, there is no way to save her from a tragic ending.

title: keizoku
body:
Keizoku, also known as Unsolved Cases, is a Japanese mystery thriller created first as a TV drama and later as a film. It is about Detective [[shibata_jun_(keizoku)|Shibata Jun]], who handles unsolved cases with her hardened partner [[Mayama Tooru]].

The television series was broadcast in eleven episodes between 8 January and 19 March 1999. A two-hour "special drama" was then broadcast on 24 December 1999. The series has been called "epoch-making" in the police procedural genre on Japanese television
